705759f-a.title: Brooklyn: Montague Street - Pierrepont Place
705759f-a.text:
Montague Street, at the N.W. corner of Pierrepont Place, showing the
Manhattan Skyline, in the background.
August 10, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
705759f-a.folder: Montague Street & Pierrepont Place, Brooklyn, NY

705778f-a.title: Brooklyn: Montague Terrace - Pierrepont Place
705778f-a.text:
Montague Terrace and Pierrepont Place. A rear view fronting on the
above mentioned Street s. The building at left fuces Pierrepont P;3ce; the
building at right on Montsgue TYerrace. The street in the center of the view
is Montague Street. The rear of both these buildings are on Furman Street.
The Pierrepont Stores are at the left.
Vpril 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
PAY BE REPPODUCED.
705778f-a.folder: Montague Terrace & Pierrepont Place, Brooklyn, NY

705776f-b.title: Brooklyn: Montague Terrace - Montague Street
705776f-b.text:
(1)
2-10 Montague Terraoe, from Montague to Remsen Streets, showing in
the foreground, the Litchfield Mansion also once the home of George 1. Seeney.
The Sanger house is at the extreme left. One of the center homes, now
occupied by the National City Bank as a club house, was the residenoe of
Jeremiah J. Robinson of the Robinson Stores, located between Fulton and
Montague Streets.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Cellection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, another view.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
705776f-b.folder: Montague Terrace & Montague Street, Brooklyn, NY
